data.title: Nice place to visit...
data.text: Dropped into this restaurant/bar establishment on a whim because of its location and was pleasantly surprised. Was greeted by our, eventual, waiter, short on stature but long on service. he explained the meal choices and apologized for the unavailability of some of the choices. The drinks were delicious. The deep fried bacon strips were crispy and satisfying. Drinks were strong and delicious. Entrees were unique, tasty and filling. Definitely on my list for a return visit.

data.title: Great Downtown Joliet Watering Hole
data.text: Was on vacation back in my hometown in July 2016.  First time visiting this eatery. Was very impressed with the food and drinks.  Great atmosphere and customer service. If you are visiting one of the downtown casino this would be an excellent choice for a change of spirit(s).  Portions are nicely sized also. Wish we had restaurants like this one when I lived in the city back in the day. :)

data.title: Hide gem
data.text: I heard this was a good spot. So a group of us ventured out after work and boy were we suprised.  The Salmon was on point and the meat tray was very very good. It has a very nice setting inside and the staff are very friendly and helpfull. A diffident place to revisit.

data.title: Snappy flavors, but that is not my thing
data.text:
The Tin Roof has almost everything I like about dining out.  High quality food... reasonable prices for what you get... interesting/quirky ambiance... good service... BUT their palate does not match mine.

I prefer rich-bold flavors, but their menu revolves around snappy-spicy flavors.

So if you prefer a little zip on your tongue, you will enjoy the food. 

I am just not one of those people.  

Will I go back?  Sure.  If a group of colleagues want to eat there for lunch when I am in town, I have no problem joining in since the food is good, but I will not go there on my own.  I just do not enjoy it the same way as everybody else does.

data.title: Lunchtime Cocktails
data.text: Tin Roof serves innovative drink cocktails along with specialty beer options. My sister and I have visted this establishment on several occasions. The cook is awesome! The management is attentive.  I highly recommend the gourmet meat and cheese board. The honey, nuts, cheeses, and meats are superb!

data.title: Unique Gem
data.text: I think walking into this place the average patron might not expect what turned out to be a really quality meal. Upon entry you are met by a bar. As you go back there are tables for probably 50-60. My wife and I were seated and promptly greeted by our server who was polite and friendly. We started with a couple appetizers, grilled mango chutney shrimp and deep fried bacon, both delicious. For the main course my wife had the farmers pasta and I had the Salmon. Definitely high quality ingredients, served quickly and perfectly with prepared. My salmon had a sauce that was equal in deliciousness to the fish itself which was fresh and lite. The pasta was great as well. Both dishes had a bit of a spice to them but not overbearing at all. This is a must visit when you are in the area!

data.title: Sadly, very disappointing
data.text:
3 of us went on a Thursday night. It was not crowded, but the singer and his guitar were so loud that we couldn't talk the whole dinner. I ordered the burger, which was just a very average, non juicy burger. the homemade fries were pretty good. My mom ordered the salmon, and said that it was ok. She gave it a 5 out 10. Her biggest complaint is that she told the waiter that she can't have anything spicy, and the rice that came with it was spicy, so she couldn't eat it. It was expensive for a piece of salmon with no sides to eat(oddly her dinner came with no optional sides, but my hubby's dinner came with a choice or a side and a soup, and they were under the same list of dinners on the menu. Not sure how they decide who gets a side and soup, and who doesn't?). The kicker was my hubby's steak. He ordered the ribeye steak medium rare. It came out and he cut into it and it is well done. It is a thin steak, so understandably this can happen. He showed the waiter, and the waiter looked at it and totally agreed that it was well done. He took his plate back to the kitchen and came back less that a minute later. The cook told him to cut in to the other side of the steak, since it is slightly thicker. Seriously??? We are talking about an 1/8th of an inch thicker, and it was just as well done.  I've never in all my life heard of a cook sending the same steak back and suggesting that the customer try cutting in to the other side and try to find some medium rare area. The waiter took the plate back, and they did replace the steak. Hubby said it was pretty good, but really not worth the hassle he felt that he shouldn't have gotten.
A couple good notes, the drinks were tasty, although expensive, hubby loved his chili, and his potatoes were really tasty. I don't think we would go back here due to the negatives though.

data.title: Great food, eclectic atmosphere
data.text:
We ate here two weeks ago.  It didn't seem quite suitable for senior citizens, as loud rock music was playing on the sound system.  We asked if the music could be turned down and the waitress took care of it.  I had the East Side Wrap - for $9
which is Tropical Rubbed Chicken, Mango Pico de Gallo, Chipotle Chutney & Queso Fresco. It was a bit spicy, but delicious.  My husband had ✪ Hector's Steak - for $11
Skirt steak, Chihuahua, red peppers which he thoroughly enjoyed.  We would definitely go back again and feel more at home next time. This restaurant is in downtown Joliet and worth the trip for excellent food.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Great food!!!  Beer selection was not stellar but the menu was unique and everything was good!  The cocktails were great.

data.title: Dinner with family
data.text: Had dinner here with my family.  The atmosphere is very nice, service and food were great.  I had the Basil Salt Salmon it was cooked perfectly and had the best flavor.  Other person in the party had a tostada and they said it was very good as well.  Highly recommend stopping here!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: The atmosphere is charming. Three of us had dinner and everyone's was delicious.  The staff were all very attentive.  We would definitely recommend this.

data.title: Awesome Cocktails
data.text: Food is good at Tin Roof, but the cocktails mixed up should be the primary reason for you visit.  Exquisitely crafted and ever changing drink menu.  Recently they have been favoring Gin but in the past they have utilized Tequila, Rum, and Whisky.  Food does come from locally sourced businesses.    And they tend to spice things up, which is not a problem with myself and my wife.  We ate Carnitas Tacos, ceviche, avocado BLT.  Carnitas were phenomenal!

data.title: Excellent food, very nice atmosphere!!
data.text: Eight of my family dined here without a reservation and were very happy with our experience.  Very nice cocktail selections, appetizers of grilled shrimp, ceviche and deep fried bacon were very yummy.  Salmon was probably one of the best I've eaten, pork chop with chorizo hash was good and others enjoyed the Diablo pasta!! I lived in this area for a long time, there are not many really good places to eat and with a Chicago style atmosphere, Go here for real dining!!! Service was a little slow, but everything else was excellent!!!

data.title: Good Food
data.text:
Unfortunately when I visited their tap beer was out of commission, but they did offer a good variety of can and bottle beers.
The location is small, but offered decent food for a reasonable price.

data.title: Farm to table comfort food
data.text: Stopped here for dinner during a cross country road trip. Only five minutes off the freeway. No traffic at 5pm on a weekday. Although there was no kids menu, the waiter gave us a few kids options which were very appreciated. Enjoyed the steak and potatoes. Just so nice to stop in a quiet, civilized restaurant instead of junky fast food at the rest areas.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: The best thing about this place is it atmosphere.  The food is OK, we had salads that were good, but smallish for the price.  We were both still hungry when finished.   The drinks are pricey, and the service was "spotty" at best.

data.title: Friday dinner
data.text: Great meal, we shared the shrimp appetizer and each had a cocktail; great drinks.   We all enjoyed our dinner.  Little on spicy side but i love it.  Great szarac too

data.title: Great for lunch!
data.text: I met a few girlfriends here for a Friday lets start the weekend earl lunch. Our lunch was great, I was a bit worried when I saw 1 waiter who was also the bartender, but luckily there wasn't too many tables as we came in. Service was good! Started with drinks, we tried the prison drink?! It was good, a little sweet yet tart then bitter at the end, I like the complicated concoction. We ordered the gavel sandwich and a special steak sandwich with steak fries. Everything was seasoned then cooked to perfection! Waiter wasn't to invasive nor did he ignore us, I think he realized we were girls with lots to talk about so he left us to do just that! Great lunch tin roof!!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Interesting experience. When we arrived I was almost taken aback by the band (Saturday night). I thought they were too loud. But little did I know, we ended up having a great time. Unique food and drinks, great bartenders, esp. Danny - the GM.  He made us feel welcome, offered us a taste of drinks and mixtures we've never seen or tried before and kept us company when he wasn't busy with other customers. The band was very entertaining as well. We will definitely be back soon. We can't wait to bring the guys a taste of Czech Beherovka and Eastern European aged brandy.

data.title: Quant place, with very good food/service.
data.text: First time here, and we luved it! Went on a Saturday early evening, so the place was not overly crowded. Seated immediately. Small, but tasty menu. They have their our "specialty drinks too. Friendly service and good prices.
